page.title: 03ARTS & CRAFTS
page.content: The USAF Base, Woodbridge, has an Arts and Craft Centre staffed by an English Principal and six American assistant lecturers, some part-time. The courses are of variable length and include pottery, modelling, mould-pouring, some sculpture,woodwork, frame-making, painting, calligraphy, heat-pressed printing (T-shirt transfers), brass- rubbing from replicas, stained glass and macrame. An average of 50-80 man- hours a day are recorded over a month, some students only attending for short periods. The work here is unlike that in any reputable English College and seems to be directed towards speedy commercialised production. The local rural population practice various arts and crafts, including book illust- ration, poetry, portrait painting, tapestry work and knitting.
